articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Improvement
  
Sounds impossible to find a guest message in seconds ? 
As we keep improving our features, we work closely with property users and managers like yourself to learn how we can help you run your business more efficiently. 
After several workshops, reflections, and feedback, our Smily team did several adjustments to help you use our centralized Inbox in order to simplify this daily communication.
We added several filters to help you find the conversations easily in the Inbox, you can now filter by the following criterias:
Conversation status
Assignee
Guest
Booking stage
Booking status
Rental
Booking tag
Rental tag

This way you can find the exact conversation you are looking for in a matter of seconds :) 
For more details please see the article from our manual
Wishing you all a pleasant day!
articles.title: Centralized inbox filters

articles.description:
Feb  9, 17:43 PST
Resolved - A fix has been implemented as of Feb 9, 10:00 UTC and webhooks should be returning names in full as expected.
We have been monitoring the situation since, and have marked the incident as resolved as of Feb 9, 20:10 UTC.
Do let us know via the Partner Portal if still experiencing issues.
We deeply regret this incident and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused to you.
Thank you for your patience and understanding.
Feb  9, 02:54 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue.
In the event reservation webhook notifications are still returning only initials for the guest name parameters, please attempt a GET reservations request.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused and are working towards a resolution.
Feb  8, 21:42 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating issues with webhooks where guest name parameters are not returning the names in full.
We will provide further updates as we learn more.
Apologies for the inconvenience caused.
articles.title: Issues Affecting Guest Name Parameters in Webhooks

articles.description:
Feb  3, 22:53 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.
If you encounter any further technical issues, please open a case via the Support Dashboard which our team will pick up and respond to in good time.
Apologies for the inconvenience caused due to this incident and thank you for your patience and understanding.
Feb  3, 22:29 PST
Monitoring - Error rates have already decreased to normal levels from 22:00 Pacific Time (PT).
We are monitoring the situation and will resolve the incident soon.
Please retry any requests that may have failed with 500 Errors.

Identified - From 21:20 Pacific Time (PT), we saw increased 500 errors for multiple API endpoints, including reservations, listings, threads, etc. The issue is now identified and we are actively working on it.
articles.title: 500 Errors Across Multiple Endpoints

articles.description:
Feb 24, 11:06 PST
Resolved - The issue has been fully resolved. Inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US-1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and MMS & SMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free are working normally. Customers who moved off US-1 may move their traffic back to US-1 at any time.
Feb 24, 09:28 PST
Update - We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes av…
articles.title: Delays in Inbound/Outbound Voice Over Interconnect and Elastic SIP Trunking in Ashburn (US1) and Time Outs in MMS

Feb 17, 11:29 PST
Resolved - From 10:46 AM PST to 11:24 AM PST, some users were unable to load their page updates and notifications performance were degraded.
This incident has since been resolved - page updates and notifications should now be back to normal.

articles.description:
Feb 13, 08:36 PST
Resolved - Engineering has implemented mitigations, which should have resolved performance issues. We’ll continue to monitor performance and provide updates if we run into issues again.
We found that page analytics events, such as page views and page edits, did not save during the time of this incident. Impacted users may see their page related analytics as undercounted for February 13, 2023. Our team is looking into how we can prevent this from happening in the future. We appreciate your patience while we work on making these improvements.
Feb 13, 08:17 PST
Investigating - Notion users may experience general performance slowness. Engineering is currently investigating and implementing mitigations.
articles.title: Performance Issues

articles.description: We’ve resolved the issue with Audio files not loading on iOS. Thank you very much for your patience while we worked on getting this fix out the door.
articles.title: Incident: Audio files not loading on iOS

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

From February 23, 2023 at 4:00 p.m. PST until February 24, 2023 at 12:13 a.m. PST, some customers were not able to use several apps within the workspace. The issue was caused by a certificate, which didn't push online successfully after renewal. The certificate has now been pushed and the issue is resolved.


*The times mentioned above have been updated since our initial posting to accurately reflect the duration of this issue.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers may be experiencing issues with several apps

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From February 23, 2023 at 5:24 p.m. PST until February 23, 2023 at 8:23 p.m. PST, some customers in the Phillipines were not able to access Slack. We looked into it and found that the issue was an external factor that we have now addressed it on our end and the impacted users have confirmed that they can now access Slack.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers in the Phillipines may not be able to connect to Slack

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

On February 22nd, 2023 from 08:44 AM PST to 09:22 AM PST, some users experienced issues with using workflows.


We discovered an issue that prevented workflow API calls from successfully writing changes to our database. After restarting this process, workflow functionality was restored for all impacted users.


We continued monitoring our metrics and announced the resolution when we were confident the issue was resolved.


If you continue to run into any issues please feel free to reach out to our support team.
articles.title: Incident: Errors when running workflows

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From Monday February 20th 2023 at 15:00 PST until Tuesday February 21st 2023 22:00 PST, 

A PR that changed the type of an argument used by the Github plugin was pushed to production. This change caused a type mismatch and subsequently HTTP 500 errors. The issue was resolved once the PR was reverted.


We're very sorry for any inconvenience caused.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers are experiencing server errors with the GitHub Enterprise Server app

articles.description:
Issue summary:


From Tuesday, February 14th, 2023 at 09:52 AM PST until Tuesday, February 21st, 2023 at 08:56 AM PST, some enterprise customers experienced issues with the delivery of mobile notifications on Android devices.


Our team identified that the cause of the issue was linked to a recent change with notification clearing. We rolled back this change which fixed the issue. 


We're very sorry for any inconvenience caused.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with mobile notifications for Enterprise Grid customers

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From February 14th, 2023 at 10:49AM PST until February 20th, 2023 at 1:16 AM PST some customers were unable to load their workspace's admin page. We traced this issue to a recent code change, which resulted in the workspace token being invalidated when visiting the admin page from a browser. Reverting this code change fixed the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers are having issues loading the admin page

articles.description:
Issue summary:


On Tuesday February 14th, 2023 from 1:19 AM PST to 3:50 AM PST some customers reported an issue where the API method files.upload created a new message instead of uploading files in a thread.


Our team identified that the cause of the issue was linked to a recent update. This change was rolled back which fixed the issue. 


Note: This summary has been edited since its initial posting to better align with Slack's communication guidelines.
articles.title: Incident: Files upload API not uploading files to thread

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On Monday February 13th, 2023 at 07:00PM to Tuesday February 14th, 2023 at 01:02 AM PST, customers were unable to view threads in public channels they had not joined. This was caused by a recent code change - we've deployed a correction to this and the issue is now resolved.


Should customers continue to experience this behaviour, a hard refresh of the Slack client will fix this.
articles.title: Incident: Threads are currently not loading for some users

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On February 8, 2023, from 12:09 PM to 4:56 PM PST, customers on the Free, Pro, and Business+ plans may have experienced issues searching for messages in Slack.


We made a recent update that unintentionally prevented search results from populating correctly. We reverted the change, resolving the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Searches are failing for some users

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On February 2, 2023, from 3:00 PM PST to 6:00 PM PST, some customers may have received a Server Error when attempting to view the Slack App Developer page. 


We traced the failures back to a recent infrastructure change. When we rolled back the change, the problem was resolved for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers may be receiving a server error when viewing our Slack App Developer page

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

On January 31, 2023 from 11:40 AM PST to 11:55 AM PST, customers may have experienced issues with workflows not running as expected or posting duplicate messages. 


A network event prevented access to some of the database servers that support workflows. This disruption meant that the remaining servers were unable to handle the workflow load. 


We restarted the affected servers and manually increased the capacity to resolve the issue, restoring normal workflow behaviour.
articles.title: Incident: Errors running workflows

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

On January 31, 2023 from 9:44 AM to 3:17 PM PST, some customers may have experienced issues creating new workspaces. 


An error in our onboarding flow meant we were incorrectly assuming new workspaces had completed the onboarding process before any onboarding actually took place, leaving these newly created workspaces in an unusable limbo state. We reverted the change that caused the initial onboarding inconsistencies, then released a fix to resolve some dependencies from the reverted file. 


Everyone should be able to create new workspaces as normal once again, although you may experience some overzealous onboarding prompts as the system resolves any lingering inconsistencies.
articles.title: Incident: Users unable to enter team name when creating a workspace

During the maintenance the eu1.make.celonis.com and eu1.make.com website login might be temporarily affected.
Some webhooks and shared hooks processed at that time might be temporarily affected as well.
There will be no impact on us1.make.com and us1.make.celonis.com.
We do not expect any data loss.
articles.title: Scheduled infrastructure maintenance

articles.description:
Jan 31, 07:00 CET
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Jan 31, 05:00 CET
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Jan 26, 16:15 CET
Scheduled - Please note there is scheduled infrastructure maintenance on Tuesday 31st of January, between 5 AM and 7 AM CEST, when you can expect few short service interruptions. 
During this maintenance following services might be potentially affected:
- Migrations will not be available
- Shared hooks created within maintenance will not be accepted nor processed
- Logins to platform might be affected
- Registration of new subscribers won't be possible
- Invitations of new team members won't be possible
- E-mails and notifications might be delayed
- Password reset won't be possible
- Payments for subscription plans won't be accepted  
We will inform you once the maintenance is completed.
articles.title: Scheduled infrastructure maintenance
